crowd.’

Razumihin glanced around nervously. 

“Why are you so anxious?” he asked.

“It’s just... I feel it. Something’s off,” Raskolnikov replied.

“Let’s hurry,” Razumihin urged. 

They quickened their pace. 

“Dounia must be safe,” Raskolnikov said.

“Agreed. We’ll protect her,” Razumihin assured.

“Did he seem dangerous?” Raskolnikov pressed.

“Not yet. But we can't be careless,” Razumihin answered.

They turned a corner, urgency in their steps. 

“Luzhin won’t get to her,” Raskolnikov vowed. 

“Together, we’ll make sure of it,” Razumihin promised.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses concern about Svidrigaïlov's intentions towards his sister Dounia after the recent death of Svidrigaïlov's wife.
